availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Patrick C. Toomey (Simpson County, Kentucky, stone mason and soldier in the 33rd and 26th KY)

body.p: Simpson County, Kentucky, stone mason and soldier. Massachusetts native. Married to Margaret Flarity Toomey. Father of Kate Toomey, Edmond Toomey, and Patrick Toomey. Stone mason in Simpson County, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in Company A 33rd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as a Private from February 13, 1863, to April 1, 1864. Served in Company F 26th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as a Private from April 1, 1864, to June 30, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Simpson County, Franklin, p. 149.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 216-7, 233.
U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Tennessee, Application #577364.
